1.text: Package your machine-washable clothes and sheets in airtight garbage bags.

2.text: Wash and dry your machine-washables on high heat to kill the bed bugs.

3.text: Place any unwashable fabric items in airtight freezer bags.

4.text: Leave the bags in your freezer for 14 days to kill any bugs.

5.text: Buy or rent a high-powered steamer to destroy bugs on contact.

6.text: Run the steamer over the surface of high-risk areas to kill the bugs.

7.text: Use a high-powered vacuum with a HEPA filter to suck bugs up.

8.text: Run the vacuum over the carpet, drapes, bed frame, and baseboards.

9.text: Buy silica aerogel or diatomaceous earth to kill the bed bugs.

10.text: Load a duster with the pesticide or snip the tip on the bottle.

11.text: Squirt the pesticide into cracks in the walls and along the baseboards.

12.text: Spread pesticide inside your drawers and around your bed frame.

13.text: Leave the pesticide for at least 10 days before vacuuming it up.

14.text: Place bed bug interceptors around your bed frame to keep bed bugs off.

15.text: Hire a professional to handle a severe infestation.
